intro: Bulbostylis trichobasis, commonly known as the hairy bulbostylis, is a small, perennial grass-like plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets, a common feature in grasses. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
